intro: Mediocalcar ericiflorum, commonly known as the heath beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to thrive in well-drained, often rocky soils. Mediocalcar ericiflorum is often found in open habitats such as meadows and forest edges.
